meanings.definition: The objective form of the pronoun 'who', used as the object of a verb or preposition.
meanings.sent1: She gave the gift to whomever asked for it first.
meanings.sent2: Whomever you choose to invite, make sure they RSVP.
meanings.sent3: The mysterious package was addressed to whomever finds it first.
meanings.sent4: In the dark forest, whomever dares to venture will discover hidden treasures.
meanings.sent5: The reward will go to whomever completes the challenge fastest.

meanings.definition: Used to introduce a clause in which the subject is the person or people who are the object of a verb.
meanings.sent1: Whomever wins the race will receive a prize.
meanings.sent2: You can leave whenever you want, whomever you please.
meanings.sent3: The chef will cook dinner, whomever shows up at the restaurant.
meanings.sent4: Like a detective, she followed the clues to whomever committed the crime.
meanings.sent5: The treasure map will lead you to whomever holds the key.
